label: 安居
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: The practice of Buddhist priests staying indoors from the 15th day of the 4th lunar month to the 15th day of the 7th lunar month in Japan, a period of 90 days corresponding to the riany season in India, and not going outside during that time, but remaining seated within their dwellings, practicing Buddhist meditation.
